Automatically send usage statistics to help us improve WordPress for Android
Looking for your Other Recent Stats? We\'ve moved them to the Insights page.
Stats couldn\'t be loaded for the required blog
To view your stats, sign in to the WordPress.com account you used to connect Jetpack.
Explore the list to see which countries and regions generate the most traffic to your site.
Discover what your most-viewed content is, and check how individual posts and pages perform over time.
Learn more about your site’s visibility by looking at the websites and search engines that send the most traffic your way
When your content includes links to other sites, you’ll see which ones your visitors click on the most.
Track the views on each contributor\'s posts, and zoom in to discover the most popular content by each author.
No tagged posts or pages viewed
Get an overview of the most popular topics on your site, as reflected in your top posts from the past week.
If you\'ve uploaded videos using VideoPress, find out how many times they’ve been watched.
If you allow comments on your site, track your top commenters and discover what content sparks the liveliest conversations, based on the most recent 1,000 comments.
Keep track of your followers from various social networking services using publicize.
Keep track of your overall number of followers, and how long each one has been following your site.
Learn more about your search traffic by looking at the terms your visitors searched for to find your site.
It\'s been %1$s since %2$s was published. Here\'s how the post has performed so far…
Check that the blog URL entered is valid
Sign in to WordPress.com for notifications
The request has expired. Sign in to WordPress.com to try again.
We\'ll always send important emails regarding your account, but you can get some helpful extras, too.
App notifications have been disabled. Tap here to enable them in Settings.
Settings for notifications that appear in the Notifications tab.
Settings for notifications that are sent to the email tied to your account.
Settings for notifications that appear on your device.

Password must contain at least 4 characters
Username must be longer than 4 characters
Username must be shorter than 61 characters

Username can only contain lowercase letters (a-z) and numbers
You can\'t use that email address to signup. We are having problems with them blocking some of our email. Use another email provider.
Username must be at least 4 characters
Username may not contain the character “_”
Username must have a least 1 letter (a-z)
That email address is already being used
That username is currently reserved but may be available in a couple of days
That email address has already been used. Check your inbox for an activation email. If you don\'t activate you can try again in a few days.
Site address must be at least 4 characters
The site address must be shorter than 64 characters
Site address may not contain the character “_”
You may not use that site address
Site address can only contain lowercase letters (a-z) and numbers
Site address must have at least 1 letter (a-z)
That site is currently reserved but may be available in a couple days
You need a more secure password. Make sure to use 7 or more characters, mix uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers or special characters.
Limit reached. You can try again in 1 minute. Trying again before that will only increase the time you have to wait before the ban is lifted. If you think this is in error, contact support.
The username or password you entered is incorrect

If you usually connect to this site without problems, this error could mean that someone is trying to impersonate the site, and you shouldn\'t continue. Would you like to trust the certificate anyway?

Check your text messages for the verification code.
